Sequence Information.Peptide Name: HP (2-20) Q17W,D19W (Anal 3; Synthetic AMPs, Lys-rich, UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (94.74%) toHP (2-20) D19WK: 32%; L=F: 11%.Activity: active against Gram+ B. subtilis (MIC 0.39 uM), S. epidermidis (MIC 0.78 uM), S. aureus (MIC 0.78 uM), Gram- E. coli (MIC 1.56 uM), P. vulgaris (MIC 0.39 uM), and P. aeruginosa (MIC 1.56 uM).Fungi: active against C. albicans (MIC 6.25 uM), T. beigelii (MIC 3.12 uM), and S. cerevisiae (MIC 3.12-6.25 uM).Toxicity: not hemo.lytic at 100 uM (0% hemolysis).Antimicrobial robustness: CaCl2-insensitive:B. subtilis (3 mM); MgCl2-insensitive:B. subtilis (3 mM);  CaCl2-sensitive:E. coli (lost 40% at 0.5 mM); MgCl2-insensitive:E.coli (3 mM).Structure:  helical structure increased in SDS micelles or 50% TFE.
Literature Information.Author: Lee DG, Kim HN, Park Y, Kim HK, Choi BH, Choi CH, Hahm KS.2002
Literature Information.Title: Design of novel analogue peptides with potent antibiotic activity based on the antimicrobial peptide, HP (2-20), derived from N-terminus of Helicobacter pylori ribosomal protein L1.
